result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakota J Monteen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid during the period of probation, or a civil judgment will be entered. Provide a DNA sample and pay the applicable surcharge.

**Restitution set at ZERO.**
Maintain full time school and/or employment.
Court grants expunction if community service, AODA, and school are completed and the defendant continues crime free living.

AODA assessment; comply with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety to include random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakota J Monteen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FORMEXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILED. OS
Bail Refund Packets

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year. Court ordered defendant to 30 days condition time in the House of Correction with Huber for work.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-AODA assessment; comply with any recommended treatment
-Absolute Sobriety to include random drug screens
-Maintain full time school and/or employment
-Restitution set at ZERO
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid during the period of probation, or a civil judgment will be entered
-Complete 30 hours of community service
-No firearms
-Provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge

*Court grants expunction if community service, AODA, and school are completed and the defendant continues crime free living.

Filed, 
Three letters on behalf of the defendant

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resoltuion. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense needs to review newly received information from the State with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
All conditions previously ordered as to bail to remain in effect.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Lakota J Monteen not in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court with attorney Theodore F. Mazza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24. Defense requests a continuation on a Pretrial Conference. Due to branch 24 being down, date set off of master calendar. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lakota J Monteen
Current: 2222 West Townsend Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 06-04-2015)
Prior: 2222 West Townsend Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Lakota J Monteen in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb
